title: Comparative adjectives
description: Practice forming and using comparative adjectives to compare two things or show change.

questions.question: Which is the correct comparative form of 'big'?
questions.explanation: 'Big' is a one-syllable adjective ending in a vowel and consonant, so we double the consonant and add '-er': 'bigger'.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: My house is _____ (clean) than yours.

content.sentence: My house is _____ than yours.

questions.explanation: 'Clean' is a one-syllable adjective. Add '-er' to form the comparative: 'cleaner'.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?

choices: This exam is more easy than the last one.
This exam is easier than the last one.
This exam is easyer than the last one.
This exam is most easy than the last one.

questions.answer: This exam is easier than the last one.
questions.explanation: For two-syllable adjectives ending in '-y', change 'y' to 'i' and add '-er': 'easier'.

questions.question: Complete: The weather today is _____ (bad) than yesterday.

content.sentence: The weather today is _____ than yesterday.

questions.explanation: 'Bad' is irregular. The comparative form is 'worse'.

questions.question: Arrange the words to make a correct sentence: 'is / than / this / more / dangerous / that'
questions.explanation: Use 'more' + adjective for comparatives with adjectives of three or more syllables: 'more dangerous'.

questions.question: Which is the correct comparative form of 'far'?
